Christopher Haupt

UK +447544094789 | CN +8615158197693 | chris.james.haupt@gmail.com

English Teacher

I am extremely friendly, professional, positive and hard-working. I very much enjoy working as part of a team and have made friends in all of my previous roles. I am dedicated to both learning and teaching and enjoy both to such an extent that the lines between work and play seem blurred. I have gained a CELTA qualification to learn to teach English to the best of my ability and have two years of teaching experience. In my short time as a teacher I have learned a lot by always being curious and always paying attention. I am confident in my ability to deliver lessons that are as entertaining as they are informative.

I'm not looking for work right now.

Experience

Wenhai Primary School

English Teacher • Aug, 2015 — Jul 2017

Wenhai is the best government school in the Xiasha district and amongst the best schools in Hangzhou. The educational standard is very high so the standard of my teaching had to be consistently equal to the school’s high expectations.

  • The teaching materials that I created and the resources that I found were often used by other teachers who would comment on what a great resource my work was.
  • Our school hosted an open class for the Xiasha district to demonstrate our school’s teaching methods to a room of almost 60 teachers. Of the ten English teachers, two were chosen to represent the school by giving an open class. Of 10 English teachers including four foreign teachers, I was one of 2 teachers chosen to give the open class because it was determined that my lessons were of the highest standard.
  • I got involved in the school community and often did things outside of my job description such as helping colleagues and students with translation, writing for the school website, and helping to organise school plays (as well as performing in them!)

Ofsted

Central Print Administrator • Apr, 2013 — Jul, 2014

Ofsted is the government’s central board of regulation for standards in education and I was brought in during a change-over period to help ease the company into a new print system.

  • Streamlining the process of label creation for specially requested mail
  • A 50% increase in efficiency of daily tasks in only two weeks (measured against average performance figures)
  • Dealing skilfully and gently with customer complaints or misunderstandings
  • Helping to regenerate output after a catastrophic machine failure using problem solving abilities (and plenty of patience)
  • Creating new templates that were better suited to certain mail tasks that improved the overall look and feel as well as adding a dimension of practicality

The Hazeley School

IT Technician • Jun, 2010 — July, 2010

The Hazeley Academy is a science specialist secondary school open since 2005. I was employed on a summer contract to help with the installation of IT systems in the new wing under construction. The contract overlapped with term-time and I was asked to help teachers and students with the new equipment

Education

Nottingham Trent University

Batchelors Degree (Joint Honours), English and Philosophy • 2011 — 2015

I was founder and president of the Nottingham Trent Cooking Society which hosted several highly successful events. To be able to run the society autonymously I attended a food hygeine course as well as two separate cooking courses. I was also an active member of the Film, Hindu, Knitting and Vegetarian societies. Besides cooking society I was also a volunteer at a local daycare centre and a freelance write for a youth magazine (see link below).

Skills

Computers and IT

I have a broad range of technical skills that allow me to use computers with an advanced proficiency. All of my work is backed up regularly and I am able to use creative tools such as Powerpoint, video editors and audio editing software to create professional-standard products. I often erase my entire operating system and install a different one because I think it's fun. Hence my online handle 'erasebegin'.

Writing

I can always be seen jotting down sudden bolts of insight as my mind wanders to the realms of philosophy and beyond. I take language seriously and writing is my favourite way to express myself. I studied English at university because my friends and relatives always told me that my literacy skills were strong.

Teaching

Few people have the good fortune to know what they enjoy most. For me it is teaching. I see teaching as a deep pursuit that takes many years of dedication to truly master. I plan to commit myself to that journey and in these early years I have already taken great strides on my way to mastery. I have been told by colleagues that I show great promise in the world of teaching.
